posts.cooked: Hi guys, recently I’ve been having a very annoying problem with the swerve, we configured the PID everything correctly, but when we rotate the swerve a lot it ends up shifting its orientation a little (in arena orientation mode) something that is also seen by us in odometry we see in advantageScope, any tips on what to do?
Is your Translational Axis changing based off of Robot Orientation?

no, it is oriented towards the arena, however when we rotate the robot very quickly, it is as if what it perceives as the front moves, all of this being visualized by the advantage scope, while we physically align the robot, in the simulation it has a deviation of rotation, causing when I throw the joystick forward it goes diagonally

When your start your robot then go froward, backward, left, right THEN you rotate your robot 90degrees then go forward, backward, left, right.

Are they the same forward, backwards, left, right?

IGNORING ODOM. I am talking about real life
We did the tests, and the deviation occurs in real life too, it goes diagonally when we put it to go forward after rotating the robot a lot

posts.name: joel truher
posts.cooked:
a gyroscope has a calibration called the “scale factor” which can lead to this sort of problem if it’s wrong.

if you “unwind” the rotations, does the problem reverse itself?

what gyro are you using?

Can you send a video? I think we are talking about the same thing but i need to be sure

And a link to your code on github
the deviation continues in the same direction, pigeon 2.0

posts.name: joel truher
posts.cooked:
fascinating.

does it happen if you rotate more slowly?  does it happen proportionally to the rotation speed?

are you ever correcting the gyro based on the odometry?  or do you leave the gyro alone?  what does the raw gyro signal say?

They might be experiencing a problem that was in the earlier versions this year and need to update to 2025.2.2; but I can’t confirm this without a video and a link to their code.

I had used the wrong units for the feedforward calculation for the drive motors (inches instead of meters)

The vídeo:

Access Google Drive with a Google account (for personal use) or Google Workspace account (for business use).
The code: GitHub - stemosofc/Swerve-stemOS_Java-2025: Código exemplo de Swerve feito pela stemOS, utilizando YAGSL e PathPlanner com comentários traduzidos

posts.cooked:
Change these to the starting values from our docs please.

"drive": {

"p": 0.00023,

"i": 0.0000002,

"d": 1,

"f": 0,

"iz": 0

},

"angle": {

"p": 0.0020645,

"i": 0,

"d": 0,

"f": 0.001,

"iz": 0

And set this line to null

{

"$schema": "https://broncbotz3481.github.io/YAGSL-Example/schemas/swervedrive_schema.json",

"imu": {

"type": "pigeon2",

"id": 13,

"canbus": "canivore"

},

"invertedIMU": true,

"modules": [

"frontleft.json",

"frontright.json",

"backleft.json",

"backright.json"

]

}

What gyro are you using? A pigeon2, navx, canandgyro?
I can’t see this video
